name: Deep Sea Conservation Coalition
goal:
The objectives of the DSCC in the EU are:
• Securing protection for vulnerable deep‐sea ecosystems and ensuring sustainable deep-sea fisheries;
• Substantially reducing the greatest threats to life in the deep seas; and
• Safeguarding the long-term health, integrity, and resilience of deep-sea ecosystems.
interests: Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Single market
euInitiatives: The DSCC is working to support the implementation of Regulation (EU) 2016/2336 of the European Parliament and the Council of 14 December 2016 establishing specific conditions for fishing for deep-sea stocks in the north-east Atlantic and provisions for fishing in international waters of the north-east Atlantic. We are also focused on ensuring that appropriate and effective regulations for exploration and exploitation are in place prior to the commencement of deep-sea mining in the high seas.
